content.text: Get the information and position for a new patent
To iron out our core IP and understand/document our differentiating technology.
This isn’t actually filing the patent.
Diagrams, documentation, etc showing a Core IP or two that has the potential to be patenable.

One of the things that might appeals to investors is filing a patent. To do so however, we would need to make sure to understand what is “patentable” and is our core IP. There are numerous concerns to consider here:
Patent lawyers can be prohibitively expensive
Companies that want to get around a patent can. It’s not as much of a blocker as you’d imagine given the time and energy.
It’s showing our hand a little to potentially other players.
Based on my experience, filing a patent can sink up a lot of time and money with not nearly as much gain as you’d think
That being said, building the case for a patent also helps us isolate our core IP and what we
patent if we wanted to. That in itself, is a learning lesson.

fields.summary: Build backbone for a patent if we were to ever file one.

content.text: We need to add some firewall to block private development work from the net.

Right now we are exposing services to the public and there is no difference between private and public services. We need to have private services accessible only through VPN, and public services accessible only through the public ingress. This is a security risk as well as it doesn’t allow us to hide our secrets will until we’ve fixed this.
